introduction_english: Let's dive into learning "習慣 (しゅうかん)", a word you'll hear often when discussing daily routines or cultural practices in Japan.
meaning_explanation_english: The word "習慣(しゅうかん)" means a habit or a custom. It refers to regular practices or traditions that individuals or cultures engage in. These can be daily routines or long-standing cultural practices that are commonly followed.

common_words: 習う: to take lessons in
慣れる: to get used to

kanji_explanation: This word is usually written in kana, so there are no kanji to explain.
synonyms: 慣習 : かんしゅう : custom
synonym_explanation: The most common synonym of "習慣(しゅうかん)" is "慣習(かんしゅう)". While "しゅうかん" focuses more on personal habits and customs, "かんしゅう" often refers to cultural or social practices and traditions.
antonym_explanation: The most common antonym of "習慣(しゅうかん)" is "新奇(しんき)". While "しゅうかん" means regular or customary actions, "しんき" refers to something new and unfamiliar, emphasizing novelty rather than established routines.

example_sentences.kanji: 読書が私の毎日の習慣です。
example_sentences.furigana: 読書(どくしょ)が私(わたし)の毎日(まいにち)の習慣(しゅうかん)です。

translations.VI: Đọc sách là thói quen hàng ngày của tôi.
translations.FR: Lire est une habitude quotidienne pour moi.
translations.TL: Ang pagbabasa ay aking pang-araw-araw na gawi.
translations.MY: စာဖတ်ခြင်းသည် ငါ့ရနေ့စဉ်ဂန်ဘှရကနေသည်။

example_sentences.furigana: 彼(かれ)はよい習慣(しゅうかん)です。

translations.VI: Anh ấy có thói quen tốt.
translations.MY: သူဟာ ကောင်းတဲ့ အမူအရာတွေရှိတယ်။

example_sentences.kanji: 彼は悪い習慣があります。
example_sentences.furigana: 彼(かれ)は悪(わる)い習慣(しゅうかん)があります。

translations.VI: Anh ấy có thói quen xấu.
translations.MY: သူသည်ဆိုးသောအမူအရာရှိသည်။

example_sentences.kanji: お正月は日本の習慣です。
example_sentences.furigana: お正月(しょうがつ)は日本(にほん)の習慣(しゅうかん)です。

translations.EN: New Year is a Japanese custom.
translations.ES: El Año Nuevo es una costumbre japonesa.
translations.VI: Tết là một phong tục của Nhật Bản.
translations.FR: Le Nouvel An est une coutume japonaise.
translations.ZH: 新年是一个日本的习俗。
translations.TL: Ang New Year ay isang kaugalian ng Hapon.
translations.MY: နှစ်သစ်ကူးသည် ဂျပန်ရိုးရာတစ်ခုဖြစ်သည်။
translations.HI: नया साल एक जापानी प्रथा है।
translations.FA: سال نو یک سنت ژاپنی است.

example_sentences.kanji: 毎日走るのは習慣にする。
example_sentences.furigana: 毎日(まいにち)走(はし)るのは習慣(しゅうかん)にする。

translations.EN: I make running every day a habit.
translations.ID: Saya membuat berlari setiap hari sebagai kebiasaan.
translations.ES: Hago que correr todos los días sea un hábito.
translations.VI: Tôi tạo thói quen chạy mỗi ngày.
translations.FR: Je fais de la course à pied tous les jours une habitude.
translations.BN: প্রতিদিন দৌড়ানো আমি অভ্যাসে পরিণত করি।
translations.ZH: 我养成每天跑步的习惯。
translations.TL: Ginagawa kong ugali ang pagbabalikwasan araw-araw.
translations.HI: मैं हर दिन दौड़ने की आदत डालता हूँ।
translations.AR: أجعل من الركض كل يوم عادة.
translations.FA: من دویدن هر روز را به یک عادت تبدیل می‌کنم.

example_sentences.kanji: 習慣を変えることは難しいです。
example_sentences.furigana: 習慣(しゅうかん)を変える(かえる)ことは難(むずか)しいです。

translations.VI: Thay đổi thói quen là khó.
translations.TL: Ang pagbabago ng mga nakagawian ay mahirap.
translations.MY: အလေ့အထကိုပြောင်းတာခက်ပါတယ်။

habit.MY: အလေ့အကျင့်

custom.MY: အလေ့အကျင့်
